Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Addabbo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrew's Roman Catholic Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y. 10007

Council Member Addabbo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 20, 2005 be adopted and printed by Council Member Lopez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lopez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 20, 2005 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, the NYC Transitional Finance Authority, the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, the NYS Dormitory Authority and the NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2006 and the ensuing three fiscal years, and the maximum amount of appropriations and expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250 (16) of the NY City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation of the discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes for Fiscal Year 2006, pursuant to the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Discount Ratefor the prepayment of real estate taxes be set at 1.5% per annum for FY'06.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of taxes on real estate, for non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health and Mental Hygiene and for non-payment of water and sewer rents.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for FY'06 for non-payment of taxes on real estate.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 050163 PCM, a site selection and acquisition shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 050162 (A) ZMM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, West Chelsea High Line, Manhattan (050163PCM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 050098 MMM, C 050170 GFM, and C 050219 PQM, shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to application no. N 050169 ZRM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Lincoln Center Development Project, Manhattan

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Finance
Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at 1.5% per annum for Fiscal Year 2006.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Discount Ratefor the prepayment of real estate taxes be set at 1.5% per annum for FY'06.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments; and 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $80,000, or not more $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Water/Sewer Rates

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $80,000, or not more than $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Small Properties

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Larger Properties

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation of the discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes for Fiscal Year 2006, pursuant to the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Discount Ratefor the prepayment of real estate taxes be set at 1.5% per annum for FY'06.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of taxes on real estate, for non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health and Mental Hygiene and for non-payment of water and sewer rents.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for FY'06 for non-payment of taxes on real estate.

Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue certain land as park land.” A.8046 / S.5373

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the business corporation law, the not-for-profit corporation law and the administrative code of the city of  New York,  in relation to the dissolution of a corporation responsible for the  payment of taxes to the city of New York.” A.7459 / S.5170
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Dissolution of a corporation responsible for the  payment of taxes to the city of New York. (A.7459 / S.5170)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S. 2516 and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz A.5273, “An Act to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairment of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.4009 and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6942, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city sanitation members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to permitting certain NYC sanitation members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement/social security law

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3217, and Assembly Member McLaughlin, A.6302, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the state finance law, in relation to the imposition of a mandatory surcharge on speeding violations committed within a work zone and the creation of a photo radar monitoring enforcement demonstration program”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: A mandatory surcharge on speeding violations committed within a work zone.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.5417, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8372, “AN ACT to amend chapter 697 of the laws of 2004, amending the general municipal law relating to certain disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments, in relation to the effectiveness of such chapter”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.4530-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7392-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to coverage for additional members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Coverage for additional members of the NYCERS.

Introduction & Reading of Bills

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information provided on canopies identifying commercial establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Information provided on canopies identifying commercial establishments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Land Use Committee to file an application to amend the text of the Zoning Resolution in regard to language requirements on signs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Land Use Committee to file an application to amend the text of the Zoning Resolution in regard to language requirements on signs.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting enactment of S.291 and A.00330, which would amend the New York State domestic relations law to establish a presumption in favor of shared parenting of minor children in matrimonial proceedings.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS domestic relations law to establish a presumption in favor of shared parenting of minor children in matrimonial proceedings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to permitting anyone who is otherwise eligible to register and vote, and who is at least sixteen years old, to register to vote in municipal elections.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Permitting anyone who is otherwise eligible to register and vote, and who is at least 16 years old, to register to vote in municipal elections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the standing or parking of large vehicles within six feet from all residential and commercial driveways.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the standing or parking of large vehicles within six feet from all residential and commercial driveways.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that the city clerk provide a standardized copy of both a living will and a health care proxy to all grooms, brides and domestic partners.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: City clerk provide a standardized copy of both a living will and a health care proxy to all grooms, brides and domestic partners.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the determination of certain buildings built prior to 1921 for landmark status.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Determination of certain buildings built prior to 1921 for landmark status.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing the emission of global warming pollution.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Reducing the emission of global warming pollution.

Items.Title: Resolution (1) to permit Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc. (Housing Company) to impose a five percent increase in carrying charges beginning July 1, 2005; (2) to permit the Housing Company to impose an additional fifteen percent increase in carrying charges in future years, in appropriate amounts as and when needed to meet further increases in operating expenses, in consultation with the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD); (3) to approve a Fourth Amendatory Agreement to the Contract between the City of New York and the Housing Company which (i) provides the Housing Company with the authority to impose future increases in carrying charges for utility, fuel and energy costs based on actual costs incurred, with the permission of HPD but without the need for approval from the City Council, and (ii) modifies the language with regard to succession and occupancy rights in the Housing Company, in place of the Fourth Amendatory Agreement previously approved by the City Council but not implemented; (4) to authorize the Mayor or any Deputy Mayor or the Commissioner of Housing Preservation and Development to execute the Fourth Amendatory Agreement when approved as to form by the Corporation Counsel and directs the City Clerk to attest to the same and to affix the seal of the City thereto; and (5) to permit a program by the Housing Company to impose a one-time capital assessment to be paid by purchasers on the first sale of shares of each apartment after the effective date of such program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Amend the contract between the City of New York and Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt and the Governor to sign A.7379A and S.1450A legislation permitting direct-to-consumer wine shipments in and out of New York State.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Wine Shipments in and out of NYS (A.7379A/S.1450A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5437, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8245, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty-five year/age fifty-five retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as a mortuary/quality assurance member subject to articles 11 and 15 of the retirement and social security law”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a 25/55 retirement program for members of NYCERS employed as mortuary/quality assurance.

Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5469, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8298, “AN ACT to make the widow and children of a former uniformed employee of the New York city department of corrections eligible for special accidental death benefits pursuant to section 208-f of the general municipal law”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Widow and children eligible fo former uniformed correction members for special accidental death benefits.

Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Suspension of employees of the parks department in cities with population million or more.

Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Coverage for additional members of the NYCERS.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.4713-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7613-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty year retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians (paramedics); and to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the establishment of twenty year retirement programs for such members who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of such law”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Twenty year retirement program for EMTs and paramedics.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5373, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8046, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue certain land as park land”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Discontinue certain land as park land.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5034-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8214, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability benefits of New York city sanitation members”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Disability benefits of NYC sanitation members.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting proposed bipartisan federal legislation for comprehensive immigration reform and urging Congress and President Bush to adopt such legislation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Supporting proposed bipartisan federal legislation for comprehensive immigration reform.

Items.Title: Resolution expressing continued opposition to the  REAL ID Act of 2005, included as part of the Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act passed by Congress and signed by President Bush in May 2005 and urging New York State to opt out of implementing the law’s provisions regarding issuance of driver’s licenses to immigrants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Expressing grave concern regarding the passage of the REAL ID Act of 2005.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to amend the penal law and the criminal procedure law to make stalking by technological means illegal, and to increase the penalties for such acts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Make stalking by technological means illegal, and to increase the penalties for such acts.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at 1.5% per annum for Fiscal Year 2006.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Discount Ratefor the prepayment of real estate taxes be set at 1.5% per annum for FY'06.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments; and 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $80,000, or not more $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Water/Sewer Rates

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $80,000, or not more than $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Small Properties

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2006 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Banking Commission - Larger Properties

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the establishment of a Responsible Prosecution Review Board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a Responsible Prosecution Review Board.

Items.Title: Roll Call

Resolution calling upon President George W. Bush and the federal Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) not to revise the operating subsidy formula for funding public housing that will cost New York City up to $166 million annually, and calls upon Congress to reject this change if imposed by HUD.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: HUD not to revise the operating subsidy formula for funding public housing that will cost NYC up to $166 million annually, and calling upon Congress to reject this change if imposed by HUD.

Items.Title:
By Council Member Arroyo:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 030537 MMX, an amendment to the City Map special permit shall be subject to Council review.

Items.Title:
By Council Member Koppell:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 4292 Katonah Avenue, Borough of the Bronx, Council District no. 11, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20055499 TCX.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 4292 Katonah Ave., Bronx (20055499TCX)

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
